pred_ans_conf_MCQ: F.W. de Klerk became the last state President of apartheid South Africa in August 1989
pred_ans_conf_OE: F.W. de Klerk became the last state President of apartheid South Africa in August 1989.
pred_conf_OE:
Score: 100

FW de Klerk was indeed the last state President of apartheid South Africa, serving from August 1989 until the end of apartheid in 1994 He played a key role in the negotiations to end apartheid and transition to a multiracial democracy, for which he was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993 along with Nelson Mandela Therefore, the proposed answer is correct, and the confidence score is 100
